Description: Fragment of flattened handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine light pink-brown; cream slip. Rectangular stamp with Helios head symbol and Greek inscription.
Production date: 170BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 55, 34. Name Athanodotos.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0912)
